ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How good was the treatment in helping you pay attention more?
How good was the treatment in helping you stop and think before you act?
How good was the treatment in helping you stay calm?
How good was the treatment in helping you get to sleep on time?
How good was the treatment in helping you to wake up on time?
How good was the treatment in helping you get your homework done?
How easy were the treatments?
Would you recommend this treatment to others kids with ADHD?
How important was the money in getting you to work hard on the treatment?
Now that you know what the treatment is like, if you were back at the beginning, would you want to do it?
How useful were the assessments (Tests, rating scales and other measures)?
How did you feel about the Frequency of tests
Notes: 1= Not Often Enough; 2= About Right; 3= Too Often

ElementDescription: How did you feel about the Frequency of visits
Notes: 1= Not Often Enough; 2= About Right; 3= Too Often

ElementDescription: Would you recommend this study to others?
What did you like about the program?
Please describe any things about this treatment you did not like
Remember that at the beginning of the study you were put in either the "real feedback" or "fake feedback" treatment; which treatment do you think you received
Notes: 0= Real Feedback; 1= Fake Feedback; Don't Know

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Validity rating
Session
Site
Respondent Source
Notes: 1= subject; 2= parent; 3= clinician; 4= teacher; 5= trainer; 6= fidelity reviewer
